intro: Alopecurus brevifolius, commonly known as meadow foxtail, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant has slender, tufted stems with small, spike-like inflorescences that produce numerous tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Alopecurus brevifolius is often considered a weed in agricultural settings but can also serve as a food source for various insects and small mammals.
